ai_analysis.summary: The money order shows no signs of alteration or forgery. All fields—including a clear, correctly spelled written amount and a present signature—align with genuine MoneyGram standards.
reasoning: ML Model indicates extremely low fraud risk (0.0% overall; RF 4.5%, XGB 6.0%), consistent with legitimate cases.

Numeric amount ($450.00) exactly matches written amount (“FOUR HUNDRED FIFTY AND 00/100 DOLLARS”) with no spelling errors in raw OCR text. Training data shows 45% of frauds involve amount mismatches—none here.
Issuer “MoneyGram” and 10-digit serial “9021056789” follow expected format; issuer_valid and serial_format_valid both pass.
Signature field is present (“Alex Chan, AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE”) and legible, satisfying mandatory signature requirement.
New customer but no escalation history or past flags; similar past approvals had comparable low-risk profiles.
actionable_recommendations: Verify purchaser’s government-issued ID matches name and address on the money order.
Record the serial number and retain a copy of the front/back of the money order in your system.
Monitor the customer’s transaction for any unusual patterns if they become a repeat sender.
